intro: Hemitelia trinitensis, commonly known as the Trinidadian hemitelia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean, particularly Trinidad and Tobago. The plant has opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
